description.text:
Role: IT Python Developer
 Seniority Level: Senior
 Location: Sundbyberg, Sweden
Workload: 80‚Äì100% full-time
 Remote Work: 25%
Application Deadline: 20 May 2025
Responsibilities:
Design architecture and ensure system security
Full-stack development (Frontend & Backend)
Automate and execute testing (manual and automated)
Manage incidents and perform operational support
Configure and maintain CI/CD pipelines
Create and update system documentation
Collaborate with users such as data scientists and power system analysts
Interact with stakeholders like domain architects, solution architects, and project managers
Other relevant tasks as needed



Technologies & Tools:
Python 3
FastAPI
SQLAlchemy
Azure DevOps
PyInstaller
RHEL
OpenShift

description.text:
Are you tired of working in monotonous environments? Seeking to level up with cutting-edge technologies and top-tier enterprises? Look no further! SwedQ puts its people first, prioritizing your career journey. We're all ears when it comes to your career aspirations. Want AWS certification? We've got you. Want to lead a team? Do it. Dreaming of becoming an Architect? Let's make it happen together by carving out a role that aligns with your goals.
SwedQ is a consulting company that works towards becoming the first choice within development and digitalization through delivering tangible results based on our clients conditions and business objectives. How do we do it? By harnessing our unparalleled Know-how, extensive experience, and laser-focused competence. We're the go-to team for turning your wildest digital dreams into a reality.
What's in it for you? 
At SwedQ, we're looking for a python developerwho's always pushing the envelope. We're not just offering a job‚Äîwe're opening up a world of opportunity. Get ready to tackle the latest and greatest tech, tackle unique challenges every single day, and experience a diverse array of environments. And get this: we're not waiting for an assignment to land on our lap. We're designing the role together with you, based on your experience and passions. Our assignments span across various industries, but our IT focus is razor-sharp. Our dynamic consultants are currently rocking out everything from implementing new cloud architectures to setting up back-end systems for self-driving vehicles. Are you ready to join the elite SwedQ crew and take on the digital world?
Our clients
We're partnering with fintech upstarts and big-name giants alike. Our talented consultants are currently flexing their skills at titans like Spotify, H&M, Scania, Ericsson, Schibsted ‚Äî among many others. The digital world is our playground, and we're constantly on the hunt for new partners to push the boundaries of innovation.
You will bring: 
 Minimum 7 years of experience in Software engineering
 Strong analytical / problem solving skills
 Good communicator
 Fluentin English
 Swedish is meritorious
 JavaScript (React, AngularJS or similar)
  AWS, GCP, Azure 
  CI/CD - Jenkins, TeamCity, Octups deploy or similar 
  Architectures - Microservices, serverless, N-Tier, REST, SOAP, GraphQL
  Other - Elasticserach. Dynamodb, Databases
 Python (Django, Flask, Bottle or similar)
 Different services within the cloud providers
 Setting up deployment pipelines towards the cloud
 
SwedQ culture
The culture is very very important to us. We're all about smashing hierarchies, embracing independence and accountability, and driving value-creating work‚Äîall while having a blast. Diversity and equal opportunity aren't just buzzwords to us‚Äîthey're baked into our DNA. So go ahead, come to the office in flip-flops or high heels, as long as you're comfortable and true to yourself. And when it comes to blowing off steam, we take fun seriously. From epic football tourneys to unforgettable trips and dinners, we're all about creating memories that last a lifetime.
Perks & Benefits 
 Competitive salary 
 Flexible working hours 
 Budget to spend on health and gym
 Generous developers budget
 Monthly payments into you additional pension fund 
 Private health insurance
 Office in the City ‚Äì Stone's throw from public transport and lunch restaurants
 Support for open source projects and community engagements 
 Developers time, to use during work hours for your personal growth 
 Kick-ass colleagues and mentors at every corner
 
Other information about the employment
 Start - Flexible starting date
 Employment - Full time
 Location - Stockholm

  • Private health insurance
  • Office in the City ‚Äì Stone's throw from public transport and lunch restaurants
  • Support for open source projects and community engagements

description.text:
Payments product team
At the heart of Wolt‚Äôs evolution from a food delivery service to an expansive super app, the Payment Products Team drives user-centric payment solutions that reshape how customers engage with our platform. You can work at the forefront of Wolt‚Äôs growth, where your contributions directly influence the future of payments and unlock new possibilities for customers worldwide.


Our humble expectations 
We are looking for experienced software engineers who can develop production-level microservices in Python & Go. In this role, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining high-quality software systems. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver robust solutions while leveraging cutting-edge technologies and best practices.
Key Responsibilities
Develop and maintain scalable backend applications, primarily in Python, with increasing use of Go expected in the coming years.
Design and optimize database schemas, queries, and indexes using SQL databases like PostgreSQL
Familiarity with asynchronous event processing (Kafka or others)
Work with containerization technologies like Docker and orchestration platforms like Kubernetes
Utilize cloud platforms such as AWS for deploying and scaling applications
Experience in Kotlin is useful

What We Value
Leadership by Example: Active participation in code reviews, mentoring, and onboarding.
Autonomy & Ownership: Our engineers have end-to-end responsibility for their services, from implementation to production.
Proactive Problem Solving: Ability to identify, own, and resolve challenges with minimal guidance.
Knowledge Sharing: A passion for fostering a culture of collaboration and excellence.



Fluency in English language is mandatory.
üåç Where You‚Äôll Work
The role is based in Stockholm, with the option to work from Helsinki. We maintain a remote-friendly setup to foster innovation and teamwork.

Du kommer att jobba i trevliga lokaler i centrala Stockholm. Det finns m√∂jlighet att arbeta hemifr√•n.

Du kommer att arbeta i varierande projekt och st√• inf√∂r intressanta utmaningar f√∂r att effektivisera f√∂retagets kunders tekniska vardag.

Du har:

Utbildning p√• kandidatniv√•

Upp till 3 √•rs erfarenhet inom utveckling

Backend programmering

CI/CD pipeline (som Jenkins, Bamboo, Tekton)

Versionshantering (som Git, SVN, BitBucket)

Meriterande:

Frontend programering (som TypeScript, react.js, Node.js, angular.js)

Arkitektur baserad p√• mikrotj√§nster

Docker

Kubernetes

Terraform

OpenShift Cloud (som AWS, Azure)

Python

Shell

C++

Configuration as code

Infrastructure as code

Du f√•r:

Arbeta i utmanande projekt med teknik i framkant

Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling d√§r certifieringar √§r en sj√§lvklarhet

Vara en del av en stimulerande arbetsmilj√∂ med h√∂gt i tak

√Öka p√• sp√§nnande konferensresor med roliga aktiviteter

Privat sjukv√•rdsf√∂rs√§kring, pensionsers√§ttning, ett ordentligt friskv√•rdsbidrag och andra gener√∂sa f√∂rm√•ner

Du kommer att bli anst√§lld hos v√•r kund. Heltid. Provanst√§llning som √∂verg√•r i en tillsvidareanst√§llning efter sex m√•nader. Tilltr√§de: omg√•ende.

Ans√∂k genom att skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Skriv ‚ÄùJunior Python Systemutvecklare ‚Äì Stockholm heltid‚Äù i √§renderaden.

description.text:
Veritaz is a leading IT staffing solutions provider in Sweden, committed to advancing individual careers and aiding employers in securing the perfect talent fit. With a proven track record of successful partnerships with top companies, we have rapidly grown our presence in the USA, Europe, and Sweden as a dependable and trusted resource within the IT industry.
Assignment Description:
We are looking for a Senior Python Test Engineer to join our dynamic team.
What you will work on:
Migrate test cases from Robot Framework to Pytest across both component and domain integration levels
Validate all migrated test cases in collaboration with the owning teams to ensure full functionality and alignment
Develop parameterized and auto-generated test cases as needed, supporting ongoing feature development
Contribute to the testing of integrated vehicle functionalities including infotainment, connectivity, diagnostics, power modes, Bluetooth pairing, mobile network access, Wi-Fi hotspots, OTA updates, media playback, voice control, navigation, and smartphone platform integration (Android Auto, Apple CarPlay)
Lead or support stakeholder collaboration, test governance meetings, request prioritization, and ensure seamless daily test execution

What you bring:
Mandatory on-site availability in Gothenburg; remote work is not permitted
Proven experience with Robot Framework and Python for test development and automation
Prior work experience in Sweden and with an automotive customer
For senior test engineer role: minimum 5 years of experience, with ability to lead test coordination and contribute to test strategy and planning
For test engineer roles: minimum 3 years of hands-on testing experience in relevant domains
Strong communication and organizational skills with the ability to manage priorities and cross-team dependencies
Proficiency in English, both spoken and written, sufficient for all aspects of the assignment

  • Proficiency in English, both spoken and written, sufficient for all aspects of the assignment

description.text:
Assignment: Machine Learning Engineer ‚Äì Onsite in Stockholm
We are seeking an experienced Machine Learning Engineer who combines strong software engineering skills with a deep understanding of data-driven systems. This role is ideal for professionals with 5‚Äì10 years of total industry experience, including at least 3 years of hands-on software development, who have transitioned into machine learning and enjoy creating scalable, real-world ML solutions.


Responsibilities:
Design and implement intelligent software systems powered by ML and AI, working with large-scale datasets and applying techniques such as feature engineering, model selection, evaluation, deployment, and monitoring.
Develop and manage scalable infrastructure for data processing and machine learning workflows, supporting robust pipelines and full model lifecycle operations.
Apply engineering best practices to ML development, ensuring code is modular, efficient, and maintainable.
Build internal tools, services, and reusable components to accelerate ML delivery‚Äîsuch as feature stores, model registries, monitoring systems, and experiment tracking.
Collaborate within cross-functional agile teams, working closely with data scientists, software developers, and stakeholders to turn data insights into production-ready systems.

Profile Requirements:
Academic background in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related discipline‚Äîor equivalent professional experience.
5‚Äì10 years of experience in tech, including 3+ years as a software engineer.
Advanced Python programming skills and experience building production-grade systems.
Proven track record of deploying machine learning models into live environments and maintaining them using modern MLOps approaches (e.g., containerization, CI/CD, testing).
Solid understanding of cloud services, ideally Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Vertex AI, but other platforms (AWS, Azure) are also relevant.
Comfort working with high-volume structured and unstructured data, including both streaming and batch processing.
Familiarity with popular machine learning libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Scikit-learn, with a pragmatic mindset for tool selection.
Strong collaboration skills and experience contributing to agile team environments.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience building internal ML tools or platforms.
Knowledge of experimentation frameworks and statistical evaluation methods.
Familiarity with DevOps tools and infrastructure-as-code solutions like Docker, Kubernetes, or Terraform.

Additional Details:
Cloud certification (GCP, AWS, or Azure) is required. If not already certified, the consultant must obtain certification within one month of starting.
Location: 100% onsite in Stockholm (remote work is not an option for this role).



About Rasulson Consulting
Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you‚Äôll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.
